metadata.title: CVE-2019-9810 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect alias information in IonMonkey JIT compiler forArray.prototype.slice method may lead to missing bounds check and a bufferoverflow. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 66.0.1, Firefox ESR <60.6.1, and Thunderbird < 60.6.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
